column1: Arbitrary file write during tarfile extraction
column2: Extracting files from a malicious tar archive without validating that the destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside the destination directory to be overwritten.
column4: This file extraction depends on a [["potentially untrusted source"|"relative:///CWE-022-codeql_2.py:18:10:18:37"]].

column2: Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

column2: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.
column4: [["Stack trace information"|"relative:///CWE-078-codeql_1.py:32:25:32:25"]] flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.

column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithms can compromise security.
column4:
[["Sensitive data (password)"|"relative:///CWE-327-codeql_4.py:3:23:3:30"]] is used in a hashing algorithm (SHA3512) that is insecure for password hashing, since it is not a computationally expensive hash function.
